textos_fuente.text: Anchorage – 49th State Brewing Can Beer Make Your Smarter? Learn More Careers Beers Sodas Pubs Denali Anchorage Ted Stevens The Rail Menus Denali Anchorage Ted Stevens The Rail Shop Gift Cards Merchandise Stories About Anchorage Visit Taplist Menu Venue Booking Catering Events Visit Taplist Menu Venue Booking Catering Events 49th State Brewing – Anchorage At 49th State Brewing – Anchorage, cultural layers of Alaska unfold around you. Delve into the long tradition of brewing with award-winning beer, explore a menu with freshly sourced Alaskan products, and relax on the rooftop patio overlooking the Cook Inlet and Alaska Range. More than a brewpub, 49th State is a community center. The array of private theaters and event spaces host concerts, seminars, conferences, and weddings. Located in downtown Anchorage, 49th State Brewing is a can’t-miss component to the Anchorage experience. Open 11am-11pm Mon-Sat and 11am-10pm Sun Beer garden is open daily, from 11am-10pm. (907) 277-7727 View the Full Calendar of Events Order Online (to go only) Join the Team To Go Food: From 5-9pm, we offer in-house dining only. To-go food is available before 5pm and after 9pm. We look forward to welcoming you at the pub! WE DO NOT OFFER DELIVERY AT THIS TIME. NOTE: WE DO NOT PARTNER WITH DOORDASH. SCAMMERS ARE CREATING FAKE ACCOUNTS. PLEASE REPORT ANY FAKE ACCOUNTS TO DOORDASH. During the Summer, we offer open seating on the pub level and at our rooftop bar. For dining, we are on a first come, first served basis. Please check-in at the host stand upon arrival. If you have a group and are interested in our private dining room or other event spaces contact events@nhgalaska.com or call 907.302.3655 lunch Starters Bar Snacks Entrée Salads Soups & Salads Bowls Pub Favorites Mains Burgers beer crust flatbreads Kid’s Menu Beverages back to top Starters Mexican Street Corn Roasted jalapeño corn, vegan chorizo, vegan cheese, sliced avocado, vegan sriracha mayonnaise, cilantro and lime juice. Served with tortilla chips. Tuna Nachos light and crisp wonton skins, marinated tuna, red onion, scallions, freshly diced avocado, sriracha mayo, kabayaki sauce, furikake, shredded nori and bonito flakes. Crab Artichoke Dip Creamy blend of crab with artichoke hearts, Parmesan cheese, roasted garlic and fresh spinach. Baked golden brown and served with warm pita slices. 49th State’s Handmade Bavarian Pretzel A labor of love, our handmade pretzel is served with our Blonde Eagle Ale beer cheese sauce. It’s our brewer’s favorite! Crispy Cauliflower Tender wings slow-smoked with our signature 49er dry rub. Served with tangy pickled carrot ribbons. Brewpub Nachos Warm tortilla chips, black olives, melted cheddar and Monterey Jack cheeses, salsa fresca, radish, pickled jalapeño and ají peppers, cilantro, Blonde Eagle Ale beer cheese sauce, freshly diced avocado and lemon sour cream. Add chicken or carne asada. 49th State Calamari Tender calamari, lightly breaded and fried with jalapeños and ají peppers, tossed in fresh parsley and house seasoning. Served with sweet chili aioli. Crab-Stuffed Jalapeños Applewood smoked bacon-wrapped roasted jalapeños filled with blended crab, cream cheese, pepper jack cheese and dried mango. Served with poblano cilantro mayo and Pico de Gallo. Bar Snacks Smōk Lager and Jalapeño Beer Popcorn Housemade Chicken Tenders Southern-style hand-breaded crispy chicken tenders with honey mustard sauce. Award Winning Smoked Wings Our tender chicken wings are slow smoked to perfection with our signature 49er dry rub. Served with pickled carrot ribbons. Blonde Eagle Ale Beer Cheese and Chips Our housemade beer cheese kicked up a notch with our famous Blonde Eagle Ale and warm tortilla chips. Entrée Salads Vegan Spicy Buddha Bowl A vegan delight! Brown rice and quinoa blend, fresh avocado, crispy sriracha chickpeas, arugula, roasted sweet potatoes, fresh red cabbage, cucumbers and cashews with a silan drizzle. Served with tahini date dressing. Classic Caesar A fresh romaine salad tossed in creamy Caesar dressing with shredded Parmesan cheese and garlic herb croutons. Add chicken, Halibut, Salmon or Steak Skewer. Baja Steak Salad Filet steak skewer, radish, avocado, cabbage and shredded romaine, roasted corn, red onion, red bell pepper, salsa fresca, Monterey Jack and cheddar cheeses. Served with cilantro lime vinaigrette. Soups & Salads Buffalo Chili Delicious blend of Alaska’s Indian Valley free range buffalo, red beans, onions, garlic and 14 spices topped with shredded cheddar and green onions. | Bowl or Cup | Add Lager Loaf +3.99 Alaska Seafood Chowder Creamy chowder teeming with fresh Alaskan king salmon, Kachemak Bay halibut and tender clams. Garden Salad Mixed greens, carrots, radishes, red onions, cucumbers and tomatoes. Icepick Wedge Iceberg lettuce, applewood smoked bacon, tomato, blue Cheese crumbles and scallions draped in our tangy blue cheese dressing. Bowls Ancho Chili AK Salmon Bowl Ancho chili spiced Alaska sockeye salmon, brown and red rice and quinoa blend, black beans, cotija cheese, warm tortilla chips, roasted corn, tomatoes, house pickled red onions, avocado, and pickled jalapeño and aji peppers with spicy honey mustard dressing. Tuna Poke Bowl Fresh marinated ahi tuna poke with golden turmeric rice, edamame, mango chutney, wakame salad, sesame cabbage, diced avocado, furikake and crispy nori. Yum Yum Chicken Bowl Hand-battered, crispy chicken tossed in a sweet Thai chili sauce, with fresh shredded radish, carrot, bell pepper, red cabbage and diced cucumbers. Served over  our sweet turmeric coconut rice, finished with sesame seeds and served with a side of our sweet and spicy peanut sauce. Pub Favorites Salmon Fish and Chips Panko breaded Alaskan sockeye salmon with seasoned brewpub fries, creamy coleslaw, housemade tartar sauce and malt vinegar. Smoked Prime Rib Melt Smoked prime rib piled high with grilled peppers and onions smoked mozzerella cheese and our secret steak sauce on grilled sourdough from the local bakery. Served with brewpub fries and beer cheese for dipping. 49th State’s Famous Halibut and Chips Wild Kachemak Bay Alaskan halibut in our light and crispy beer batter, seasoned brewpub fries, creamy coleslaw, housemade tartar sauce and malt vinegar. Basecamp Chicken Sandwich Southern-style hand-breaded crispy chicken with horseradish bread-and-butter pickles, shredded lettuce and mayo. Served on a pub bun with brewpub fries The 49er’s Famous Halibut Tacos Blackened Kachemak Bay halibut nestled in corn and flour blend tortillas with cabbage, Monterey jack and Mexican cheeses, salsa fresca, cilantro and housemade lemon sour cream. Served with chips and salsa fresca. King Crabby Grilled Cheese Grilled sourdough bread, crab meat blend, and Appenzeller Swiss and cream cheeses. Served with brewpub fries and our famous Alaska seafood chowder for dipping. Mains Colossal Shrimp Basket Alaska sized buttery, breaded shrimp with brewpub fries, creamy coleslaw, served with peppercorn cocktail sauce and homemade tartar sauce. World Famous Yak Burger* Locally raised Alaskan yak has a delicate, juicy flavor. Housemade burger topped with caramelized onions, honey-pepper applewood smoked bacon and smoked Gouda cheese. Served with lettuce, tomato, onion, mustard, pickles and mayo on a pretzel bun with tots. Baked Mac-N-Cheese An American classic. Elbow macaroni noodles, creamy Alfredo and aged cheddar cheese sauce, topped with Parmesan breadcrumbs and baked in an iron skillet. Add steak and bacon + 6.99. Add seafood and crab meat blend + 8.99. Alaska Wild King Salmon The best salmon in the world! This rich and buttery wild caught Alaska King Salmon is grilled to perfection on a bed of brown and red rice, kale, red quinoa, black barley, roasted seasonal vegetables, and lemon cream sauce. Parmesan and Asiago Crusted Halibut Filet of fresh Kachemak Bay halibut topped with Parmesan and Asiago cheeses served with lemon butter sauce, garlic smashed potatoes, and seasonal vegetables. Bering Sea Red King Crab A POUND AND A HALF of real, world famous Bering Sea red king crab served with drawn butter, seasonal vegetables, and garlic smashed potatoes. MP Burgers Twin Peaks Two patties smothered in American cheese with mustard and pickles. Served with brewpub fries. Sleeping Lady Cheddar cheese, lettuce, tomato, onions, pickles, mayo, and mustard. Served with brewpub fries. Mt. Magnificent Honey-pepper applewood smoked bacon, aged smoked cheddar cheese, smashed potatoes, crispy onions and our Blonde Eagle Ale BBQ sauce. Served with brewpub fries. Elk Smash Alaska Indian Valley Meats ground elk*, white Cheddar cheese, sautéed onion, pickles and chipotle mayo on a pretzel bun. Served with tots. World Famous Yak Burger* Locally raised Alaskan yak has a delicate, juicy flavor. Housemade burger topped with caramelized onions, honey-pepper applewood smoked bacon and smoked Gouda cheese. Served with lettuce, tomato, onion, mustard, pickles and mayo on a pretzel bun with tots. The Herbivore Vegan Burger Signature vegan patty blended with portobello, shiitake, white mushroom and sweet corn. Topped with vegan cheddar, vegan basecamp sauce, horseradish pickles, arugula and tomato on a pretzel bun. Served with tots. Beer Crust Flatbreads Classic Cheese Margherita House red sauce, fresh mozzarella cheese and fresh basil Pepperoni Double pepperoni, red sauce, fresh oregano, Parmesan, mozzarella and provolone cheeses. Supreme Red sauce, mozzarella and provolone cheeses, pepperoni, sausage, red onion, green pepper, mushroom and pickled goat horn peppers. ‘Shrooms Alfredo sauce, mozzarella and provolone cheeses, button, shiitake, and portobello mushrooms fresh thyme and Parmesan. Chicken Ranch Ranch sauce, mozzarella and provolone cheeses, grilled chicken, bacon and Roma tomatoes Meat Lovers Red sauce, mozzarella and provolone cheeses, pepperoni, bacon, elk, and fennel sausage. Fireweed Red sauce, fennel sausage, goat cheese, roasted garlic cloves, fresh arugula and hot honey. 49th State Red sauce, ground elk, sliced reindeer sausage, roasted red peppers, and fresh mozzarella. 50th State Red sauce, mozzarella and provolone cheeses, smoked Canadian bacon, pineapple, bacon and sweet Peruvian peppers. BBQ Chicken Blonde Eagle Ale BBQ sauce, mozzarella and provolone cheeses, grilled chicken, bacon, smoked Gouda cheese and cilantro. Spicy Reindeer Red sauce, reindeer sausage, Fresno chilies, pickled goat horn peppers, honey, smoked Gouda, mozzarella and provolone cheeses and scallions. Vegan Spicy Sausage Red sauce, vegan spicy sausage, red onion, chili flakes, and vegan mozzarella. Vegan Pepperoni Red sauce, vegan pepperoni and vegan mozzarella. Kid’s Menu Cheese Pizza Our crisp and tender crust topped with red sauce and our cheese blend. Classic Hot Dog A classic hot dog in a warm bun. NO NITRATES & ALL-NATURAL ALL BEEF Add Cheese Mac-N-Cheese Elbow Macaroni baked in our housemade creamy cheese sauce. Chicken Strips Housemade chicken strips battered and fried. Served with brewpub fries and ketchup. Cheeseburger All Alaskan beef burger with Cheddar cheese and a side of fries. Halibut and Chips A fresh Alaskan Halibut strip battered and fried. Served with brewpub fries. To exceed your expectations, add Alaska’s finest award-winning craft beers and outstanding menu options, and you have the recipe for your events’ success. Book Now heritage theater theater info The Heritage Theater is our premium event space with rustic decor and a full size stage and custom built full-service bar. Great for banquets, concerts, fundraisers, and comedy shows. Our skilled catering team will create a dining experience to fit your event and impress your guests. book now capacity 2400 sq. ft. 120 Banquet Style 200 Theater Style 350 Cocktail Style included Tables & Linens Catering Staff Audio Visual Private Bar House Décor space layouts wedding business theater cocktail Walkthrough LOADING – 49th State Brewing Theatre Room – Meeting Setup barrel room east Barrel Room East info The Barrel Rooms are our medium-size event spaces with barrel plank design and an elegant hardwood finish. These flowing spaces can be used together or separated for a more intimate setup. East is larger with the barrel stave theme. book now capacity 1850 square feet 70 seated 100 cocktail included Tables & Linens Catering Staff Audio Visual Private Bar House Décor space layouts banquet business cocktail Walkthrough LOADING – 49th State Brewing Barrel Rooms – Event Setup barrel room west Barrel Room West Info The Barrel Rooms are our medium-size event spaces with barrel plank design and an elegant hardwood finish. These flowing spaces can be used together or separated for a more intimate setup. West is slightly smaller with a more neutral décor. book now capacity 1635 sq. ft 50 seated 70 cocktail included Tables & Linens Catering & Staff Audio Visual Private Bar House Décor space layouts business Mixed Use Cocktail Walkthrough LOADING – 49th State Brewing Barrel Rooms – Event Setup private dining room Private Dining Room Our Private Dining Room is perfect for small lunch or dinner gatherings for family, birthdays, business dinners, presentations, and more. Historic photos line the walls with linen covered tables, windows that face 3rd Ave, a fireplace, and small AV setup. Book Now capacity 280 sq. ft 24 seated 30 cocktail included Tables & Linens Catering & Staff Audio Visual House Décor space layouts business banquet cocktail Full Facility Full Facility & Rooftops If you have a large event or need multiple spaces, ask us about renting out the entire facility or a combination of rooms. That includes the option to book our award winning patio or rooftop for an amazing outdoor event with breathtaking views of the Cook Inlet and downtown Anchorage. book now capacity 30,000 sq. ft. 500 seated 1000 cocktail included Tables & Linens Catering & Staff Audio Visual Private Bars House Décor Inspiration Iditarod D2 Iditarod Pub AKBIZ Rooftop AKBIZ Rooftop Walkthrough LOADING – 49th State Brewing Company FAQS How do I contact you? Fill out our form. Here is the link . Can I order flowers through you? We have an excellent selection of recommended flower vendors. Our experienced, event planning team can offer general guidance as well. We will also work with your chosen vendor to ensure the delivery goes smoothly. We do not currently offer a flower service. Are Animals Allowed? Service animals are welcome at 49th State Brewing. However, our Anchorage brewpub does not offer an indoor animal friendly space at this time. If you’re renting the beer garden, we have an off-leash dog park and dogs are allowed in the beer garden on a leash. Can I get custom beer cans? You sure can! Our event director can coordinate this with you. Can I use your venue for my band’s concert? Absolutely! Bands and promoters rent our spaces as a venue regularly. Do you have a valet? Parking downtown is easier than you might think. After 6pm, the meters are free. We are directly across the street from a large parking lot operated by Diamond as well. Many people choose to use Uber, Lyft, or Taxis. We do not offer valet service. event Request Make mealtimes memorable with Pick ‘n’ Click Catering from 49th State Brewing. Spend your time with family, friends, and colleagues instead of worrying over the stove and cleaning up dishes. Choose from our chef approved menus loaded with fan favorite foods, award-winning beers and craft sodas. It will be expertly packed and ready for you to pick-up at the time of your choosing. Pick ‘n’ Click Catering Game Day Pizza Party Office Lunch How does it Work? step 1 Choose the menu theme. step 2 Pick the food, beer and soda for your event. step 3 Pick it up at your scheduled time. Thursday 4pm - 9pm Friday 4pm - 10pm Saturday 1pm-10pm We will no longer be open Sundays. Trivia with Tap! Join us Thursday, Sept. 4 for Trivia Night with TAP! Join us September 12th for an evening of music with Gilly & The Girl when they take the stage from 6 pm - 9 pm. This popular acoustic duo will entertain you with music from various genres across the decades. Be sure to make your reservation! CLOSED FOR PRIVATE WE WILL BE CLOSED SATURDAY, SEPTEMBER 13TH FOR A PRIVATE EVENT. Trivia with Penny! Join us Thursday, Sept. 18 for Trivia Night with Penny! You can compete by yourself or with a team of up to 6 people. The brewery opens at 4 pm. Trivia begins at 6:30 pm. The Survivors Live! The Survivors Band will take the stage Saturday, September 20th at 2 pm. Come spend an afternoon chillin' to various genres of easy listening music. The brewery opens at 1 pm so you can settle in with your favorite brew Paint Along With Penny! Join us Thursday September 25 from 6:30 to 8:30 and come paint along with Penny at Nine State Brewery! Learn how to paint this mountain lake landscape! NO EXPERIENCE NECESSARY! This is perfect for beginners. Penny will take you step-by-step through the painting process. All supplies will be available for you (easel, canvas, paints, brushes, etc.), but you can certainly bring any other supplies you may need. The brewery opens at 4 pm. Painting will begin at 6:30 pm. Come early to set up, socialize, and enjoy your favorite craft beer. $20 per person, NO REFUNDS. Purchase tickets here! Josh Higgins Live! Josh will be back in the house, on September 27th, with his bluesy spin on many of your favorite songs. He will take the stage at 6 pm until 9 pm. Bring your friends for a chill evening with Josh and the best craft beer around! Josh Higgins Live! Josh will be back in the house, on September 27th, with his bluesy spin on many of your favorite songs. He will take the stage at 6 pm until 9 pm. Bring your friends for a chill evening with Josh and the best craft beer around! Beer Food Events About the brewery Nine State Brewery is located in downtown Inverness, FL. Eric Lesage, the owner and head brewer, has been brewing beer for over 10 years. His journey started in Massachusetts and throughout his brewing journey, he has traveled between Massachusetts and Florida (“Nine States”) to land at this craft beer destination. Our goal is to create a relaxing atmosphere for beer and wine drinkers to come and spend time with friends. We are driven towards making our brewery a calm, quiet and relaxing stop in your day to enjoy some of our hand-crafted beer, wine, sangria, seltzer and Korean Food. We pride ourselves on the small town feel and want a personal experience with all of those who walk through our door. Allen brewery owner arrested on murder charge in Carrollton, a week after arrest in alleged Ponzi scheme Skip to Main Content Skip to footer Sections Search TDMN News Business Sports High School Sports Arts & Entertainment Food Go See DFW Opinion Sign In Manage Account ePaper Subscribe Subscribe Today 99¢ FOR 6 MONTHS Discover Future of North Texas Standard of Fear Weather Curious Texas Advice Store Abode Podcasts ePaper Obituaries Public Notices Help Center 89 °F 90 ° 64 ° Advertisement This is member-exclusive content icon/ui/info filled news | Crime Allen brewery owner arrested on murder charge in Carrollton, a week after arrest in alleged Ponzi scheme Keith Ashley, who founded Nine Band Brewing, is accused of murdering Jim Seegan in an attempt to gain control of his finances, Carrollton police say. By Brandi Addison Special Contributor Nov. 18, 2020 | Updated 4:12 p.m. CST | 3 min. read Keith Ashley, owner of Nine-Band Brewing Company in Allen, photographed on April 17, 2014. Rose Baca / neighborsgo staff photographer Updated at 4:08 p.m. with additional information about Keith Ashley’s job at City Hospital at White Rock in Dallas. The owner and founder of Nine Band Brewing Co. in Allen has been arrested on a murder charge in Carrollton, police said Wednesday, less than a week after he was arrested on federal fraud charges alleging he ran a million-dollar Ponzi scheme. Keith Ashley, 48, is accused of murdering Jim Seegan on Feb. 19 in an attempt to gain control of his finances, according to a news release from the Carrollton Police Department . He was arrested on the wire fraud charges Friday, according to the release, and is being held at the Fannin County Sheriff’s Office without bail. Keith Ashley, owner of Nine Band Brewing Company in Allen, has been arrested for federal fraud and murder charges. Rose Baca / neighborsgo staff photographer Ashley was Seegan’s friend and financial adviser and would visit his home periodically, police said. Seegan’s death was initially ruled a suicide after a typed note was found next to his body, but police say detectives found evidence that Ashley staged the situation. In the left hand of the 62-year-old was a semi-automatic handgun, according to the arrest warrant. The last sentence of the “suicide note" — without any handwriting or signature — read, “My last friend Keith Ashley will help you” with Ashley’s phone number included. Crime in The News Read the crime and public safety news your neighbors are talking about. SIGN UP Or with: Google By signing up, you agree to our Terms of Service and Privacy Policy. Seegan’s wife Sakida “Dida” Seegan told investigators her husband was right-handed and didn’t own a gun, leading to a series of investigations. While viewing the home’s video surveillance, detectives determined Ashley was the last person inside the home before Dida Seegan discovered her husband dead in an upstairs office that day. Advertisement According to the arrest warrant, an autopsy showed Seegan had Etomidate in his system, a drug that is used as a general anesthetic. Detectives said Seegan was not a drug user and didn’t appear to have any emergency medical care that would have necessitated the use of Etomidate, which is not easily accessible outside of a hospital. Ashley, a registered nurse, worked for City Hospital at White Rock in Dallas at the time of Seegan’s death. Hospital communications staff said he worked there from May 19, 2019, to July 14, 2020, when he was terminated for not working enough shifts. Carrollton police provided this photo of Jim Seegan of Carrollton, who police now say was murdered after his death in February 2020 was initially ruled a suicide. Courtesy / Carrollton Police Department When Dida Seegan reached out to Ashley to notify him of his passing, he told her he needed Jim Seegan’s phone to contact his financial institutions. She told detectives that Ashley told her he “accidentally” deleted the messages between the two men. Detectives said Ashley wired $20,000 from Jim Seegan’s bank account while in possession of the phone — without consent from Dida Seegan, according to the arrest warrant. During the course of the nine-month investigation with the FBI and the U.S. Attorney’s Office, police said they discovered other victims of a “Ponzi-type scheme" perpetrated by Ashley. Anyone with information related is asked to call 972-466-9133 or email crimetips@cityofcarrollton.com . Advertisement Court documents accuse Ashley of cheating investors of more than $1.1 million by using funds from his financial services company, North Texas Money Management, for personal purposes, including brewery expenses, mortgage payments, casino spending and student loans. Ashley, a former financial partner of McKinney’s Franconia Brewing Company, was the subject of a 2014 Dallas Morning News story about the opening of Nine Band Brewing. The Allen Economic Development Corporation provided Nine Band with $75,000 in economic incentives to open the city’s first brewery, named after the nine-banded armadillo. The city did not immediately respond to a request for comment Wednesday. At the time, Ashley said he chose Allen over other cities because of its proximity to Dallas, the support of city officials and the city’s family-friendly atmosphere. Advertisement “I’m a very family-oriented individual, and I have to feel that same feeling,” Ashley said in the article. “I have to know that the city that I’m with is going to be supportive. And I get that feeling here in Allen.” The brewery and taproom, located at 9 Prestige Circle, lists about a dozen different styles of beer on its website . Representatives from the brewery could not immediately be reached Wednesday. Related Residents of one North Texas city can spend more than others on holiday shopping this season, study says ex.co script has been added to the page By Brandi Addison Brandi is a freelancer covering all things Frisco and Allen. She graduated from Texas Tech in December 2018, and soon after, began her career as a reporter in West Texas. She recently moved back to D-FW, which she calls home.
